revised_title: The Discovery and Impact of Inert Gases
tldr: This article recounts the discovery of inert gases, specifically argon, by Lord Rayleigh and Sir William Ramsay. Their discovery led to the identification of other inert gases like helium, neon, krypton, and xenon. These gases, which have no chemical reactivity, play a significant role in the Periodic Table and have various applications in industry and research.
